intro: Cryptantha echinella, commonly known as the spiny cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are usually hairy and glandular, and its fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases seeds when mature. Cryptantha echinella is often found in open grasslands and chaparral environments.
